meanings.definition: To live or reside in a place.
meanings.sent1: Birds are inhabiting the trees in the park.
meanings.sent2: People enjoy inhabiting cozy homes during winter.
meanings.sent3: The squirrels are inhabiting the treehouse, thinking they are the owners.
meanings.sent4: Imaginary creatures are inhabiting the depths of the forest.
meanings.sent5: The idea of aliens inhabiting Mars captures our imagination.

meanings.definition: To occupy or take up space in a place.
meanings.sent1: Books are inhabiting the shelves in the library.
meanings.sent2: Toys often end up inhabiting the floor of a child's room.
meanings.sent3: The colorful balloons are happily inhabiting the ceiling.
meanings.sent4: Laughter can be heard inhabiting the room during the party.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of fresh cookies inhabiting the kitchen is irresistible.
